intro: Tragopogon tesquicola, commonly known as the western goat's-beard, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a distinctive seed head that resembles a goat's beard, giving it its common name. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Tragopogon tesquicola is often found in areas with full sun and well-drained soil conditions.
